data.title: panda: Get rid of few warnings
data.body:
- Correct missing override
        - Correct deprecated XKeycodeToKeysym
        - Correct deprecated @exec for FreeBSD pkg plist

Signed-off-by: deflected <deflected@users.noreply.github.com>

data.title: Maya 2017 support
data.body: Added entries to compile Maya 2017 plugins.

data.title: Code formatting cleanups in StagedObject
Add DynamicHeightfield
data.body:
DynamicHeightfield is a subclass of PfmFile. Changes to it can be propagated to BulletHeightfieldShape and ShaderTerrainMesh. ShaderTerrainMesh can automatically recompute its chunk bounds based on these updates.
Additionally, ShaderTerrainMesh has a few convenience methods for coordinate conversion between world-, UV-, and heightfield- (= PfmFile = DynamicHeightfield) space now.
PfmFile has a method rotate_from to rotate the content of another PfmFile arbitrary degrees.

Sample (requires Bullet and models from [bullet-samples](https://github.com/wolfgangp/panda3d_bullet_samples)):

[27_HeightfieldVehicle.py](https://github.com/wolfgangp/panda3d_bullet_samples/blob/master/27_HeightfieldVehicle.py)

data.title: Add properties to Bullet classes
data.body:
Note: The Panda Bullet API allows setting steering in degrees on the BulletVehicle, or in radians on its BulletWheels.

BulletVehicle basic functions before (still works!):

self.vehicle.set_steering_value(steering, 0)
self.vehicle.set_brake(brake_force, 2)
self.vehicle.apply_engine_force(engine_force, 3)

Works now and may be future recommendation:

self.vehicle.wheels[0].steering = steering
self.vehicle.wheels[2].brake = brake_force
self.vehicle.wheels[3].engine_force = engine_force

data.title: Changes to help speed up the python code
data.body:
Figured out in the last couple commits how to squash the commits when editing directly on github.  The first couple were not.

Still have some other changes which I will do later.

data.title: Is is faster than ==
Correct several spelling mistakes in Panda3D sample program: Chessboard
data.body: 6 spelling mistakes are found in code comments

data.title: Fixes for device button handling
data.body: Changes to make the buttons of a device not only usable using events but also the get_button* functions from the python side. Previously button states weren't correctly set by the evdevInputDevice class and the button states enum was not accessible at al from python.

data.title: Directtools fixup
data.body:
Fixed a bunch of errors and made some enhancements within the direct tool set.
Also made the scene editor usable again for some small prototyping, testing and debugging models.

A short summary of what has been done:
- Enhanced scene graph explorer with new parts and better resizeability
- moved some useful features from scene editor to directtools (e.g. loading animations in the animPanel)
- Made the scene editor mostly work again
  - Cleaned up most of the old/deprecated Panda3D features from the scene editor
  - Removed some old scene editor scripts by replacing them with directtool alternatives
- Fix and handle many exceptions esp. from tk and pmw usage

data.title: Fixed an exploit in ServerRepository which allowed clients to send in…
data.body: …complete packets which would result in the buffer raising an assertion error, because it couldn't unpack the specified values correctly.

data.title: Fix typo of include guard.
data.body:
This fixes typo of include guard in parametricCurveCollection.h file.

I found compile error when I included both nodePathCollection.h file and parametricCurveCollection.h file.

data.title: Add hidden window mode
data.body:
This PR implements an enumerated type for window modes. Support is added for the existing window mode properties as W_regular, W_fullscreen, W_undecorated. Fullscreen and undecorated support is handled by delegating to the existing properties. We can look into removing these to reclaim bits in the Specified bitfield and make the window modes truly mutually exclusive (right now some odd combinations can be set). However, for now I tried to keep the changes to a minimum to reduce the risk of bugs.

A new W_hidden WindowMode is implemented for X11 to hide a window from the window manager. Support for macOS and Windows is still TODO.

The changes were tested using a modified version of the asteroids sample.
[window_mode_test.zip](https://github.com/panda3d/panda3d/files/703519/window_mode_test.zip)



This PR is more of a request for review and feedback than a request for a merge at this point in time.

data.title: Add prc variable to force image bindings as writeonly
data.body:
Usually image inputs are only used as writeonly variables, this pr adds a new prc option `gl-force-image-bindings-writeonly` which forces all those bindings to be writeonly.

This is equivalent to passing `read=False, write=True` on all `set_shader_input` calls for image bindings, and just a more convenient way.

data.title: Do not call expensive BulletDebugNode::sync_b2p() if the node is not in a live scenegraph
data.body:
I have some code [here](https://github.com/Moguri/prototype-lithium/blob/master/game/lithium/components.py#L211) that attempts to toggle Bullet debug drawing on/off. To my surprise, the very expensive BulletWorld::sync_b2p() was still being called even though the BulletDebugNode was not visible (or even in the scenegraph).

I've switched my code to use explicit show()/hide() calls, which prevents the debug code from running and killing my frame time. However, this PR may still be useful to others.

data.title: Do not throw an assertion when processing a light source shader input…
data.body:
… that does not have a light

Instead, return an identity matrix. This allows shaders to use an
arbitrary size for p3d_LightSource instead of needing to know the number
of lights ahead of time. Extra lights should not affect the final
shading result.

data.title: Added fixed functions pipeline checking in runtime
data.body:
The possibility of removing the fixed functions pipeline in compilation time is quite nice. However, the engine should be able to automatically detect when they are not available in runtime as well.
Otherwise the core profile OpenGL implementations will not properly work, for instance, in generic binary distributed packages of the engine

data.title: Remove PiratesMagicWordManager VR Studio code reference
data.body:
This code has references to the VR Studio game called Pirates Online of the Caribbean. Unfortunately, this code is not compatible with the current server repository. Calling execCommand throws an error.

I have replaced the proprietary code with a notify call instead.

data.title: Add functional header to parser-inc
data.body: This allows interrogate to parse `std::function<>` and all other types in the standard library header `functional`.  Unfortunately interrogate can not handle variadic templates at the moment, so I had to comment out some definitions.

data.title: Update stdint.h
data.body:
This adds missing definitions from the standard library header ` stdint.h` to the interrogate header.
I also changed the `typedef` to the C++11 style `using`.

data.title: Cleanup .gitignore files
data.body:
Remove all .gitignore files in subdirectories and add a few new ignores
to the top-level directory .gitignore file.

``git status`` still shows no untracked/modified files after a build with these changes.

data.title: Serializability of bullet shapes completed.
data.body:
Working on a project of mine, I noticed that not all bullet shapes implemented the TypeWritable API for serialization on bam file. So I implemented serialization for those who lacked. In particular:
- made serializable the following shapes: BulletHeightfieldShape, BulletCapsuleShape, BulletConeShape, BulletCylinderShape, BulletConvexPointCloudShape, BulletMinkowskiSumShape, BulletMultiSphereShape
- corrected the serialized parameters for BulletBoxShape (the old version led to a growth of the box size during restoring)
- also added the linear and angular velocity as serialized data for BulletRigidBodyNode, so that also the dynamic state of the rigid body could be restored.

As far as possible I tried to follow the original author's programming style (enn0x), but I had to add some variables only used for serialization, as bullet, sometimes, changes the original creation parameters, and therefore hardly obtainable by bullet underlying structures.
I attached a test script: the scene is saved on exit on 'scene.bam' file, and put this file as argument to restore it
[bullet_shapes_test.zip](https://github.com/panda3d/panda3d/files/557862/bullet_shapes_test.zip).

@rdb
